security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no runtime code execution. The included Python validator is a static analysis tool that only reads files for pattern validation. No network calls, no credential access, no code execution capabilities.

low_findings.title: Static analysis tool reads source files
low_findings.description: The validate-patterns.py script uses open() to read TypeScript/JavaScript files for pattern validation. This is standard static analysis behavior. Lines 62-64 show: 'with open(file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:' which reads files only for pattern checking, with no modifications.

content.value_statement: Next.js 15 introduces new patterns that are easy to get wrong. This skill provides comprehensive guidance on App Router, Server Components, Server Actions, and caching strategies so agents build correctly the first time.
actual_capabilities: Guide on Server vs Client Component decisions with decision trees
Provide 150+ code examples for Next.js 15 patterns
Validate code patterns using included Python static analyzer
Explain caching strategies and revalidation approaches
Show proper Server Action implementation with security best practices
Document metadata API and SEO optimization patterns
limitations: Does not execute code or modify project files
Does not install dependencies or configure build tools
Does not replace reading official Next.js documentation for edge cases

prompt_templates.title: Create page
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new Next.js 15 page at /projects that fetches and displays a list of projects using Server Components.

prompt_templates.title: Add interactivity
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Client Component that allows users to delete a project using a Server Action with proper loading and error states.

prompt_templates.title: Optimize caching
prompt_templates.prompt: Add proper caching to our product pages. Products should be cached for 1 hour and revalidated when inventory updates.

prompt_templates.title: Add metadata
prompt_templates.prompt: Add dynamic metadata to our blog post pages including Open Graph images, Twitter cards, and JSON-LD structured data.

output_examples.input: Create a Server Action that creates a new project with name and description fields.

best_practices: Default to Server Components and only add 'use client' when needed for interactivity
Always specify cache strategy for fetch calls (force-cache, no-store, or revalidate)
Use Zod for Server Action validation and sanitize all user input
Implement proper error boundaries and loading states for better user experience
anti_patterns: Async Client Components - causes build errors and performance issues
Using instead of from next/image - breaks build and optimization
Missing cache strategy on fetch calls - unpredictable caching behavior
Server Actions without authentication checks - security vulnerability

faq.question: What Next.js 15 features does this skill cover?
faq.answer: App Router, Server Components, Server Actions, data fetching, caching, metadata API, route handlers, and streaming.

faq.question: How many code examples are included?
faq.answer: Over 150 practical examples covering all major Next.js 15 patterns with real-world use cases.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my codebase?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance and the optional Python validator only reads files for static analysis.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using the validator?
faq.answer: Yes. The Python script only reads .tsx, .ts, .jsx, .js files and outputs validation results. No data is transmitted.

faq.question: Why am I getting 'useState is not valid in Server Components'?
faq.answer: Server Components cannot use React hooks like useState. Add 'use client' directive at the top of the file before imports.

faq.question: How does this compare to Next.js 14 patterns?
faq.answer: Next.js 15 improves Server Actions with useActionState, better async params handling, and enhanced caching APIs. This skill covers all new patterns.
